newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK's Dragonfield says IPO 67.6 times subscribed.
newsitem.headline: HK's Dragonfield says IPO 67.6 times subscribed.

text.p: Leather garments manufacturer Dragonfield Holdings Ltd said on Thursday its initial public offering (IPO) of shares in Hong Kong was 67.6 times subscribed.
The company said it received applications for 5.48 billion shares compared with the 81 million shares available for public subscription.
Another nine million shares reserved for staff were fully allotted, it said.
Trading in the shares is expected to begin on May 15.

Dragonfield offered 90 million new shares at HK$1.00 each in an IPO, raising capital to fund expansion of production facilities, set up showrooms and offices in China and Eastern Europe, and increase processing capacity of dry cleaning services.
The company has a sales and distribution network of 150 outlets throughout China.
